Oʻzbekiston (rasman: Oʻzbekiston Respubl: Uzbekistan (officially: Republic of Uzbekistan) is a country located in the central part of Central Asia. Its capital is Tashkent. The official language is Uzbek. The area is 448,978 km2 [10]. The country currently has a total population of over 37 million [11]. The currency is the soum. The territory of the Republic of Uzbekistan consists of 12 regions, the city of Tashkent, and the Republic of Karakalpakstan, and it is also an independent, democratic, secular, and constitutional state. However, non-governmental organizations have described Uzbekistan as an authoritarian state with limited civil rights[12]. Uzbekistan is a member of the CIS, the UN, the OSCE, and the SCO. Uzbekistan is landlocked, i.e., with five countries that do not have a coast, namely: Kazakhstan to the north; Kyrgyzstan to the northeast; Tajikistan to the southeast; Afghanistan to the south; and borders Turkmenistan in the southwest
Oʻzbekiston bayrogʻi — Oʻzbekiston gerbi: The flag of Uzbekistan is the official state symbol of the Republic of Uzbekistan, along with the coat of arms of Uzbekistan and the anthem of Uzbekistan. After the Republic of Uzbekistan declared its independence on August 31, 1991, on November 18, 1991.[2] The Law on the State Flag of the Republic of Uzbekistan was adopted at the VIII session of the Supreme Council of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
O'zbekiston respublikasi bayrog'i: Flag of the Republic of Uzbekistan
O'zbekiston respublikasi Gerbi: Coat of arms of the Republic of Uzbekistan
Oʻzbekiston Respublikasining Davlat Ger: The State Emblem of the Republic of Uzbekistan is the official state symbol of the Republic of Uzbekistan. It was adopted on July 2, 1992. The state emblem is one of the symbols of state independence. The Republic of Karakalpakstan, which is part of Uzbekistan, uses the coat of arms of Uzbekistan, but the regional colors are blue, gold and green. It features only one river, the Amu Darya, and a local monument in the background of the coat of arms bordered by mountains.
